intro: Acnida alabamensis, commonly known as the Alabama acnida, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in moist, acidic soils in woodland areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
